meanings.definition: Remove buds from (a plant) to improve the quality of the flowers.
meanings.sent1: She disbuds the roses carefully to make them more beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The gardener disbuds the plants to ensure larger, more vibrant blooms.
meanings.sent3: The flowers were so happy when she disbudded them, they felt like they were getting a haircut!
meanings.sent4: Disbudding the plants is like giving them a makeover for a special occasion.
meanings.sent5: With each gentle touch, she disbuds the plants, revealing their full potential.

meanings.definition: A bud that has been removed from a plant to improve the quality of the flowers.
meanings.sent1: She collected the disbuds to prevent them from regrowing on the plants.
meanings.sent2: The bouquet was stunning, with disbuds adding a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent3: The disbuds in the vase looked like little promises of future beauty.
meanings.sent4: Each disbud represented the potential for a more magnificent bloom.
meanings.sent5: The florist carefully selected the disbuds to create a perfect arrangement.
